children.title: Person at alarm-receiving facility before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted at alarm receiving facility.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.1 If the system is connected to an alarm receiving office, the alarm receiving office shall be notified that the fire system test is to be conducted and that an emergency response by the fire department or alarm station personnel is not desired.

children.title: Time alarm-receiving facility notified.
children.hint: Note time called prior to testing.

children.title: Building Management notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.2  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be notified that a test is to be conducted.

children.title: Time Building Management notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.

children.title: Building Occupants Notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.2  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be notified that a test is to be conducted.

children.title: Time Building Occupants notified.
children.hint: Note time called prior to testing.

children.title: Person at alarm-receiving facility after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted at alarm receiving facility.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time alarm-receiving facility notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Building Management notified after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time Building Management notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Building Occupants notified after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time Building Occupants notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Date and Time system restored to normal operation.
children.hint: Date system restored to normal operation.

children.title: System Configuration
children.hint: Select system configuration

options.text: Main Building Fire Alarm Control Panel

children.title: Building tied to alarm system
children.hint: 5.7.4 Connection to the Alarm System. The extinguishing system shall be connected to the fire alarm system, if provided, in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 72, National Fire Alarm and Signaling Code, so that the actuation of the dry chemical system will sound the fire alarm as well as provide the function of the extinguishing system.

children.title: System hazard is without changes.
children.hint: 11.3.1.1(1)   As a minimum, such maintenance shall include the following:  (1) A check to see that the hazard has not changed

children.title: Operating Instructions posted.
children.hint: 10.4.3.4 The labeling of devices with proper designations and instructions shall be verified.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Warning signs in place.
children.hint: 5.6.1.3 Safety items to be considered shall include, but not be limited to, the following:  (2) Warning signs

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge nozzles without damage and protective covers in place.
children.hint: 11.2.1 On a monthly basis, inspection shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual or the owner’s manual.  (5) The system shows no physical damage or condition that might prevent operation.   (7) The nozzle blowoff caps, where provided, are intact and undamaged.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Manual actuator unobstructed.
children.hint: 11.2.1 On a monthly basis, inspection shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual or the owner’s manual.  (2) The manual actuators are unobstructed.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Tamper indicators and seals are intact.
children.hint: 11.2.1 On a monthly basis, inspection shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual or the owner’s manual. (3) The tamper indicators and seals are intact.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Maintenance tag in place.
children.hint: 11.2.1.1 As a minimum, inspection shall include verification of the following:  (4) The maintenance tag or certificate is in place.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System area unobstructed and in proper location.
children.hint: 11.2.1.1 As a minimum, inspection shall include verification of the following:  (1) The extinguishing system is in its proper location

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Manual actuator operating instructions posted.
children.hint: 10.4.3.4 The labeling of devices with proper designations and instructions shall be verified.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Piping free of damage & securely fastened.
children.hint: 5.9.1.4 The piping system shall be securely supported and shall not be subject to mechanical, chemical, or other damage  10.4.2.2 Verification shall be required that piping supports are securely fastened

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Agent distribution piping not obstructed.
children.hint: 11.3.1.1(3)  At least semiannually and after any system activation, maintenance shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual.   (3)*Verification that the agent distribution piping is not obstructed

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Dry Chemical Agent Examination
children.hint: 11.3.1.1(4)   At least semiannually and after any system activation, maintenance shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual.   11.3.1.1 As a minimum, such maintenance shall include the following:  (4) Examination of the dry chemical (If there is evidence of caking, the dry chemical shall be discarded and the system shall be recharged in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.)

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Nozzles are correct type & properly aimed.
children.hint: 11.3.1.1(2)   At least semiannually and after any system activation, maintenance shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual.  (2) An examination of all detectors, expellant gas container(s), agent container(s), releasing devices, piping, hose assemblies, nozzles, signals, and all auxiliary equipment

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System operation tests.
children.hint: 11.3.1.4  All dry chemical systems shall be tested, which shall include the operation of the detection system, signals, and releasing devices,including manual stations and other associated equipment.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge time delay, if provided, operates correctly.
children.hint: Per manufacturers'settings.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
AV Alarms operated correctly.
children.hint: 9.5.1 Upon actuation of a fixed automatic fire-extinguishing system, an audible alarm or visual indicator shall be provided to show that the system has been actuated.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Automatic detection & manual actuation functioned correctly.
children.hint: 11.3.1.4  All dry chemical systems shall be tested, which shall include the operation of the detection system, signals, and releasing devices,including manual stations and other associated equipment.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Pressure regulators operates correctly.
children.hint: 11.3.1.6  Pressure regulators shall be operationally checked at least annually to ensure they meet the equipment manufacturer’s recommended static outlet pressure and minimum flow rate tolerances.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Hydrostatic Testing of System Components
children.hint: 11.5 Hydrostatic Testing. Hydrostatic testing shall be performed by persons trained in pressure-testing procedures and safeguards and having available suitable testing equipment, facilities, and an appropriate service manual(s).   11.5.1* The following parts of dry chemical extinguishing systems shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test at intervals not exceeding 12 years:   (1) Dry chemical containers  (2) Auxiliary pressure containers  (3) Hose assemblies

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Temperature and quantity of replaced fusible links
children.hint: 11.3.2* Fixed temperature-sensing elements of the fusible metal alloy–type shall be replaced at least semiannually from the date of installation

children.title: Verification-of-service collar in place on applicable containers.
children.hint: 11.3.1.2.5  Each system container that has undergone maintenance that includes internal examination or has been recharged shall have a verification-of-service collar located around the neck of the container.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Tag indicates current maintenance date and person performing service.
children.hint: 11.3.1.10  Each dry chemical system shall have a tag or label indicating the month and year the maintenance is performed and identifying the person performing the service; only the current tag or label shall remain in place.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System returned to full operation.
children.hint: 5.5.5  All shutoff systems shall require manual resetting prior to restoration of the operating conditions existing before operation of the extinguishing systems.   10.4.5.1   Verification shall be required that each extinguishing agent storage container is reconnected and the system has been returned to its fully operational condition.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Overall system condition after test.
children.hint: Indicate if the system passed or failed.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System in service at arrival.
children.hint: Indicate if system was active prior to testing.

children.title: Lamps/LEDs function properly.
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(2(d))  Illuminate lamps and LEDs.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Panel connected to dedicated circuit and labeled properly?
Take a picture of the issue
Ground fault detection connected?
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(3)(c))  If the system has a ground detection feature, verify the occurrence of ground-fault indication whenever any installation conductor is grounded.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Disconnect switches operating properly.
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(3(b))  If control unit has disconnect or isolating switches, verify performance of intended function of each switch. Verify receipt of trouble signal when a supervised function is disconnected.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Secondary (standby) power supply
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(2(e))  Disconnect and test all secondary (standby) power under maximum load, including all alarm appliances requiring simultaneous operation.  Reconnect all secondary (standby) power at end of test. Test redundant power supplies separately.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Power supply supervison operating properly.
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(2(a)) Functions - Verify correct receipt of alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals (inputs); operation of evacuation signals and auxiliary functions (outputs); circuit supervision, including detection of open circuits and ground faults; and power supply supervision for detection of loss of ac power and disconnection of secondary batteries.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Abort switch operates properly
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(18(a)) Operate abort switch and verify correct sequence and operation.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Batteries installed and operating properly.
children.hint: Table 14.3.1(2(a(4)))  & 14.3.4 Periodic visual inspections in accordance with Table 14.3.1 shall be made to assure that there are no changes that affect equipment performance.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Battery Type
children.hint: Enter battery type

children.title: Battery size
children.hint: Enter battery V/aH

children.title: Manufacture date
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Serial #
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Barcode
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Visual Inspection
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.3.1(9)  Inspect for corrosion or leakage. Verify tightness of connections. Verify marking of the month/year of manufacture (all types).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load Test results voltage #1
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(4))  Verify the battery performs under load, in accordance with the battery manufacturer’s specifications

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load test - voltage - #1
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Load Test results voltage #2
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(4))  Verify the battery performs under load, in accordance with the battery manufacturer’s specifications

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load test - voltage - #2
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Discharge Test
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9)  With the battery charger disconnected, load test the batteries following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Verify the voltage level does not fall below the levels specified. Load testing can be by means of an artificial load equal to the full fire alarm load connected to the battery. Verify the battery does not fall below 2.05 volts per cell under load.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge Test reading
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Charger Test
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9) With the batteries fully charged and connected to the charger, measure the voltage across the batteries with a voltmeter. Verify the voltage is 2.30 volts per cell ±0.02 volts at 77°F (25°C) or as specified by the equipment manufacturer.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Charger Test reading
children.hint: enter results

children.title: Manufacturer Date
children.hint: enter mfr date of agent container

children.title: Expellant Container Manufacturer Date
children.hint: enter mfr date for cartride, if applicable.

children.title: Pressure gauge in operable range
children.hint: 11.2.1 On a monthly basis, inspection shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual or the owner’s manual. (6) The pressure gauge(s), if provided, is inspected physically or electrically to ensure it is in the operable range.  11.3.1.7 Auxiliary pressure cylinders that incorporate hand operable valves shall have their pressure checked at least annually with a device to verify the cylinder pressure meets the equipment manufacturer’s tolerance specifications.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Container(s) without damage or corrosion.
children.hint: 11.3.1.1 As a minimum, such maintenance shall include the following: (2) An examination of all detectors, expellant gas container(s), agent container(s), releasing devices, piping, hose assemblies, nozzles, signals, and all auxiliary equipment

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Last Hydrostatic Test Date - Container
children.hint: 11.5.1* The following parts of dry chemical extinguishing systems shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test at intervals not exceeding 12 years:  (1) Dry chemical containers  (2) Auxiliary pressure containers  (3) Hose assemblies 11.5.2 Dry chemical containers, auxiliary pressure containers, and hose assemblies shall be subjected to a hydrostatic test pressure equal to the marked factory test pressure or the test pressure specified in the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual.

children.title: Last Date for Stored Pressure Dry Chemical Examination
children.hint: 6 year - 11.3.1.2 Dry chemical in stored pressure systems shall not require semiannual examination but shall be examined at least every 6 years.

children.title: Last Hydrostatic Test Date - Expellant Container
children.hint: 11.5.1* The following parts of dry chemical extinguishing systems shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test at intervals not exceeding 12 years:  (1) Dry chemical containers  (2) Auxiliary pressure containers  (3) Hose assemblies 11.5.2 Dry chemical containers, auxiliary pressure containers, and hose assemblies shall be subjected to a hydrostatic test pressure equal to the marked factory test pressure or the test pressure specified in the manufacturer’s design, installation, and maintenance manual.

children.hint: Enter name of person spoken to or phone number called.

children.title: Time test started
children.hint: Indicate what time test began.

children.title: Alarm signal received
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(4(a))  Actuate initiating device and verify receipt of the correct initiating device signal at the supervising station within 90 seconds. Upon completion of the test, restore the system to its functional operating condition

children.title: Alarm signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: The verification process does not take longer than 90 seconds from the time the alarm signal is received at the supervising station until the time that retransmission of the verified alarm signal is initiated.

children.title: Alarm restoral time.
children.hint: NFPA 72 26.2.5.1 All supervising station fire alarm systems shall be programmed to report restoral signals to the supervising station of all alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals upon restoration of the activation

children.title: Trouble signal received
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(a))  Actuate initiating device and verify receipt of the correct initiating device signal at the supervising station within 90 seconds. Upon completion of the test, restore the system to its functional operating condition

children.title: Trouble signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: Indicate time to receive signal

children.title: Trouble restoral time.
children.hint: 26.2.5.1 All supervising station fire alarm systems shall be programmed to report restoral signals to the supervising station of all alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals upon restoration of the activation.

children.title: Supervisory signal received
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(a))  Actuate initiating device and verify receipt of the correct initiating device signal at the supervising station within 90 seconds. Upon completion of the test, restore the system to its functional operating condition

children.title: Supervisory signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: Indicate time to receive signal

children.title: Supervisory restoral time.
children.hint: 26.2.5.1 All supervising station fire alarm systems shall be programmed to report restoral signals to the supervising station of all alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals upon restoration of the activation.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Functional Test
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table (17(g(1)))  Test smoke detectors in place to ensure smoke entry into the sensing chamber and an alarm response. Use smoke or a listed and labeled product acceptable to the manufacturer or in accordance with their published instructions. Other methods listed in the manufacturer’s published instructions that ensure smoke entry from the protected area, through the vents, into the sensing chamber can be used.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Sensitivity Test
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(17(h))  Perform any of the following tests to ensure that each smoke detector is within its listed and marked sensitivity range:  (1) Calibrated test method  (2) Manufacturer’s calibrated sensitivity test instrument  (3) Listed control equipment arranged for the purpose  (4) Smoke detector/control unit arrangement whereby the detector causes  a signal at the control unit when its sensitivity is outside its listed sensitivity range   (5) Other calibrated sensitivity test method approved by the authority having jurisdiction.

children.hint: Optional

children.title: The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information.
Technician License
children.hint: Add technician license, if multiples then separate by comma.
